item.title: UK has stressed human rights to Bangladesh’s interim govt: Commons leader
item.description: The UK is actively engaging with the humanitarian situation in Bangladesh and has stressed its long-standing commitment to human rights to the interim government of the country, says Alan Campbell, leader of the House of Commons. He made the remarks in response to a question from Bob Blackman, the

item.title: South Korea court sentences ex-president Yoon to 5 years in prison for obstruction
item.description: A South Korean court on Friday sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison for charges including obstructing attempts to arrest him following his failed bid to impose martial law. The Seoul Central District Court said it found Yoon guilty of obstructing authorities from exec

item.title: US officials hold virtual meeting with Tarique Rahman on tariff issue
item.description: Trump administration officials on Friday held a virtual meeting with Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) acting chairman Tarique Rahman to discuss the interim government's negotiated tariff agreement and explore ways to strengthen bilateral trade ties. The meeting was held from 9:00am to 9:30am (BS

item.title: Pakistan-Saudi-Turkey defence deal in pipeline
item.description: Pakistan, Saudi Arabia and Turkey have prepared a draft defence agreement after nearly a year of talks, Pakistan's Minister for Defence Production said, a signal they could be seeking a bulwark against a flare-up of regional violence in the last two years. Raza Hayat Harraj told Reuters on Wednesd

item.title: 6.1 magnitude quake hits off coast of U.S. Oregon
item.description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.1 jolted off coast of the U.S. state of Oregon at 0325 GMT on Friday, the GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences said. The epicenter, with a depth of 10.0 km, was initially determined to be at 43.77 degrees north latitude and 127.82 degrees west longitude.

item.title: Uttara building fire: Death toll rises to five
item.description: The death toll from a fire at a residential building in Dhaka’s Uttara has risen to five. The fire, which broke out on the second floor at a six-storey building in Uttara Sector No. 11, was reported around 7:50 am on Friday, according to Talha Bin Jashim, a spokesman for the Fire Service. T

item.title: Man killed in mob beating over theft suspicion
item.description: A35-year-old man was beaten to death by a mob over allegations of theft at Snikantanagar Bazar in Ramnagar Union in Jashore Sadar upazila early Friday. The deceased was identified as Shamim, son of Chabdu. He was a resident of Baladanga village in the Sadar upazila, reports UNB. According to pol

item.title: CWAB president Mithun reports threats against players
item.description: The crisis in Bangladesh cricket has taken a serious turn as Mohammad Mithun, president of the Cricketers' Welfare Association of Bangladesh (CWAB), said he has been receiving severe threats involving physical harm to players. Mithun alleged that he has been receiving abusive calls and WhatsApp me

item.title: Bag of crude bombs found in Gazipur college pond
item.description: A bag containing crude bombs, locally known as 'cocktails', has been caught in a fishing net cast on a pond in Gazipur’s Sreepur Upazila. Sreepur Police Station chief Mohammad Nasir Ahmed said the bombs were found around 8:00 am on Friday in the pond of Piyar Ali College in the Maona Bazar a

item.title: RAB recovers Highway Police firearm ‘looted’ during July Uprising in Cumilla
item.description: The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) has recovered two firearms in Cumilla, including one that was looted from the Highway Police during the July Uprising, reports bdnews24.com. The weapons were found abandoned in a roadside pond in Muradnagar Upazila around 2am on Thursday, said RAB-11 Company Comm

item.title: Two workers killed in Rangamati road crash
item.description: Two workers were killed and another was seriously injured when a pickup truck overturned and fell into a roadside ditch on the Asambasti-Kaptai road in Rangamati district town last night. The deceased were identified as Sadek Chakma, 38, and Milan Chakma, 50, both residents of Kamilachhari area in

item.title: Major blaze extinguished in deprived area of South Korea's Gangnam district
item.description: A major fire that broke out early on Friday in a deprived area of the upmarket Gangnam district of Seoul was brought under control and fully extinguished about eight hours later, a fire official said. "We are relieved that we were able to extinguish the fire without any casualties," the official s
